item.description:
He who drinks beer sleeps well.

He who sleeps well cannot sin.

He who does not sin goes to heaven.

Amen.

- Unknown German monk

 

Let's explore informal logic.  

 

According to the experts at Monty Pythons Flying Circus an..."argument is an intellectual process. Contradiction is just the automatic gainsaying of anything the other person says."

What are the limits of logic? What makes a good argument, a good debate?

What is deductive reasoning?  

Inductive reasoning?

What is a premise?  

Axioms?

An argument by analogy?

Logical independence?        A priori?

What knowledge do we have beyond our experiences?

How can we apply "Principle of Excluded Middle" when evaluating an argument?

 

What are some common types of argument flaws? What argument techniques are fair game in a debate?  

An emotional appeal?  

An appeal to authority?  Appeals to correlation? And why do these meetup descriptions always have so many questions?    Come join us for an argument, or two!

 

After the formal meetup is over, we'll go out for some sin preventing beer.
